dimensions: Warp: 244 cm (8 ft.) Weft: 92 cm (36 1/4 in.) at widest point. Right selvedge present only occasionally. Pattern: height of repeat: 99 cm (39 in.) Plate line visible just under France in a chariot.
title: Textile
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plates on plain weave foundation
description: Roman figures preparing a sacrifice at an altar under an elaborate canopy with a female figure holding a crown representing Fortune with a putti holding a Phrygian cap pointing to an open book in symmetry with Fame with a trumpet all on the right side. On the left, the figure of France in a chariot drawn by two lions accompanied by figures representing Wisdom, Hope and an unknown figure under a temple containing an eternal flame. All surrounded with drapery and elements of French gardens. In red on white.
name: Textile
